content: this is too hard for shortest in my opinion. i got it down to 464 bytes in C and it took me like 12mins so i would suggest you remove shortest mode

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A not too difficult challenge but good practice for processing substrings and loops

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems good.

One change that I recommend making is removing the 'In the example...' line from the statement.

Statement needs rework. It's not clear from the statement alone.
And it's not clear at all that the grid may only contain 2s, 1s, and 0s. 
Also, make the first test more telling. Put an actual grid here, not just a '2021'.
Also, I suggest removing 'The new year is 2021.' Someone will play it in 2022. And in 2023 maybe. And remove warning about diagonals there no need for it.

I was able to solve it in just under 5 minutes so the difficulty seems perfect to me.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: The exercise seem too complicated for a CoC

You haven't specified constraint for next n lines. 

Also, this problem statement doesn't seem fun to me, if I receive such problem in CoC I will eventually give less rating.

I recommend that you modify the statement such that there is something more to the statement (learning, fun, etc.)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Je pense que le contexte est en cohérent avec la nouvelle année et le problème est intéressant à être jouer en clash of code
Interesting contribution, especially for new year
Thank you. I modified the statement slightly as looks like I missed the New Year now. Just trying to get it approved!
Merci, j'espère que cela vous plaira si ça passe enfin.
I have changed the statement. It was meant to be a fun thing for start of the New Year - seems I've missed that one!

Sorry you find it too hard for a CoC. I made it solvable in 5 minutes and, depending on your language choice it should be achievable in that time. It follows the strategy of a typical CoC and having done a few recently is much less onerous than some!
Out of interest what part made it too complicated for you?

Thank you for reviewing it. I've made some of the changes you mentioned and added a final test case and deliberately changed its validator to kill the hard coders.
I'm keeping the example short so that those with incomplete solutions might still pass the first test. The forward and back should be easier so I thought to test them on the up an down first would be fairest.

Great, it already looks better in my opinion.

I also suggest replacing "ASCII rows of numerals" with "grid" since you're already using this term later and it's simple and accurate.

Also, even tho it's not required it would be good if tests included corner cases like N=100; ROW length=1; and ROW length=30. Or you may just change Constrains so existing tests would become corner cases.

Amended to remove ASCII.
I've also dded a couple more to test row limit and column limit. Life's too short to make a full grid up! Just need to get it approved now and it'll be my first contribution. When you compete in CoC you forget the difficulty and time that goes into making one.
